item.description:
Mount Auburn Cemetery in Cambridge is famous for its concentrations of warblers and other migrant birds. It's possible to see 16 to 18 species of wood-warblers there in one day. Join accomplished wildlife photographer (and Tufts employee), Rich Turk, for a walk through this beautiful and historic cemetery at the peak of spring migration. It's a great way to see and learn about spring migrating birds.

Since we know that only the die-hards will want to meet at 7:00 a.m. and there aren't many birds around during the mid-day hours, we've decided to make this a late afternoon/early evening event.  We'll meet at Jasper White's Summer Shack at Alewife at 2:00 for a late lunch and then proceed to the cemetery from there.  We're estimating we'll be birding from approximately 4:00 to 6:00.  The cemetery closes at 7:00 p.m.

The below items would be helpful for this event:

  • Binoculars
  • A portable birding guide
  • A camera with a zoom lens (if you want to take photographs)

Jasper White's Summer Shack Website:

http://www.summershackrestaurant.com/Locations_Cambridge.asp

Mount Auburn Cemetery Website:

http://www.mountauburn.org/?gclid=CMGL38bHr64CFUjd4AodLntXTg

If we have more than 10 people, we'll need to register with the cemetery, so we'll ask for RSVPs by Monday, May 7 at 5:00 p.m.

Hope to see you there!

Some recent bird photos

http://www.mountauburn.org/2012/sweet-auburn-magazine-spring-2012-birding-photo-submissions/
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet at The Summer Shack, 149 Alewife Brook Parkway Cambridge, MA--we'll be wearing Tufts logo apparel so you can spot us.
item.name: Spring Migration at Mount Auburn Cemetery--and a late lunch at The Summer Shack
